questions.question: She ……………………. every time a boy talks to her.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habits.

questions.question: He boasted that he ……………………… the best swimmer in school.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: She wore the bogus diamonds and …………………………… the real ones in the vault.
questions.description: Left is the past simple form of leave.

questions.question: More facts …………………………… to bolster your argument.
If you order three books, you ……………………….. a fourth one as a bonus.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: To reach the iron ore deposit, engineers had to ……………………. through solid rock.
questions.description: To bore is to drill or pierce.

questions.question: He ………………………….. for a boyish prank.
questions.description: We need a passive verb here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: He constantly brags about how well he …………………………. golf.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, the verb takes the marker -s when the subject is a singular noun or pronoun.

questions.question: In general, rifles ……………………. smaller bores than shotguns.
questions.description: We use have with plural subjects and has with singular subjects.

questions.question: In tennis you …………………….. the ball before the second bounce.
questions.description: Must shows strong obligation or compulsion.

questions.question: I ………………………… a championship bout.
questions.description: The present perfect is common with the time expressions ever and never.
